page.title: 01WREXHAM GAZETTEER
page.content: THIS BLOCK COMPRISES THE SOUTHERN PART OF THE TOWN OF WREXHAM. THE MAIN SHOPPING AREA,THE BUSINESS CENTRE AND THE OLD INDUSTRIAL OF TOWN ARE ALL HERE. THE MOST IMPORTANT BUILDINGS ARE THE CHURCH OF ST.GILES,THE BORDER BREWERY,SWIMMING BATHS,POLICE STATION AND THE GROVES HIGH SCHOOL. THE LOWER PART OF THE BLOCK IS RURAL,MAINLY PASTORAL FARMING. ERDIGG HALL,A NATIONAL TRUST PROPERTY AND FOR MANY YEARS THE HOME OF THE YORKE FAMILY LIES IN THE S.W.CORNER OF THE BLOCK. THE BLOCK LIES BETWEEN THE RICH CHESHIRE PLAIN TO THE EAST AND THE WELSH HILLS WHICH LIE TO THE WEST. THIS POSITION EXPLAINS THE GROWTH OF THE TOWN AS THE PREMIER MARKET TOWN OF THE AREA.
